org.cloudbus.cloudsim.brokers

Class DatacenterBrokerAbstract

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSimEntity
      • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.brokers.DatacenterBrokerAbstract
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Runnable, DatacenterBroker, Identificable, Nameable, SimEntity
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatacenterBrokerSimple

    public abstract class DatacenterBrokerAbstract
extends CloudSimEntity
implements DatacenterBroker
    An abstract class to be used as base for implementing a DatacenterBroker.
    Author:
    Rodrigo N. Calheiros, Anton Beloglazov, Manoel Campos da Silva Filho

    • Method Detail

      • submitVmList

        public void submitVmList(List<? extends Vm> list,
                         double submissionDelay)
        Description copied from interface: DatacenterBroker
        Sends a list of VMs for the broker that their creation inside some Host will be requested just after a given delay. All VMs will be added to the DatacenterBroker.getVmsWaitingList(), setting their submission delay to the specified value.
        Specified by:
        submitVmList in interface DatacenterBroker
        Parameters:
        list - the list of VMs to request the creation
        submissionDelay - the delay the broker has to include when requesting the creation of VMs
        See Also:
        DatacenterBroker.submitVmList(java.util.List), Delayable.getSubmissionDelay()

      • submitVmList

        public void submitVmList(List<? extends Vm> list)
        Sends to the broker a list with VMs that their creation inside a Host will be requested to some Datacenter. The Datacenter that will be chosen to place a VM is determined by the DatacenterBroker.selectDatacenterForWaitingVms().

        If the entity already started (the simulation is running), the creation of previously submitted VMs already was requested by the CloudSimEntity.start() method that is called just once. By this way, this method will immediately request the creation of these just submitted VMs in order to allow VM creation after the simulation has started. This avoid the developer to dynamically create brokers just to create VMs or Cloudlets during simulation execution.

        Specified by:
        submitVmList in interface DatacenterBroker
        Parameters:
        {@inheritDoc} -

      • submitCloudletList

        public void submitCloudletList(List<? extends Cloudlet> list)
        Sends a list of cloudlets for the broker to request its creation inside some VM, following the submission delay specified in each cloudlet (if any). All cloudlets will be added to the DatacenterBroker.getCloudletsWaitingList().

        If the entity already started (the simulation is running), the creation of previously submitted Cloudlets already was requested by the CloudSimEntity.start() method that is called just once. By this way, this method will immediately request the creation of these just submitted Cloudlets if all submitted VMs were already created, in order to allow Cloudlet creation after the simulation has started. This avoid the developer to dynamically create brokers just to create VMs or Cloudlets during simulation execution.

        Specified by:
        submitCloudletList in interface DatacenterBroker
        Parameters:
        {@inheritDoc} -
        See Also:
        submitCloudletList(List, double)

      • submitCloudletList

        public void submitCloudletList(List<? extends Cloudlet> list,
                               double submissionDelay)
        Description copied from interface: DatacenterBroker
        Sends a list of cloudlets for the broker that their creation inside some VM will be requested just after a given delay. All cloudlets will be added to the DatacenterBroker.getCloudletsWaitingList(), setting their submission delay to the specified value.
        Specified by:
        submitCloudletList in interface DatacenterBroker
        Parameters:
        list - the list of Cloudlets to request the creation
        submissionDelay - the delay the broker has to include when requesting the creation of Cloudlets
        See Also:
        DatacenterBroker.submitCloudletList(java.util.List), Delayable.getSubmissionDelay()

      • bindCloudletToVm

        public boolean bindCloudletToVm(Cloudlet cloudlet,
                                Vm vm)
        Description copied from interface: DatacenterBroker
        Specifies that an already submitted cloudlet, that is in the waiting list, must run in a specific virtual machine.
        Specified by:
        bindCloudletToVm in interface DatacenterBroker
        Parameters:
        cloudlet - the cloudlet to be bind to a given Vm
        vm - the vm to bind the Cloudlet to
        Returns:
        true if the Cloudlet was found in the waiting list and was bind to the given Vm, false it the Cloudlet was not found in such a list (that may mean it wasn't submitted yet or was already created)

      • processEvent

        public void processEvent(SimEvent ev)
        Description copied from interface: SimEntity
        Processes events or services that are available for the entity. This method is invoked by the CloudSim class whenever there is an event in the deferred queue, which needs to be processed by the entity.
        Specified by:
        processEvent in interface SimEntity
        Parameters:
        ev - information about the event just happened

      • processDatacenterCharacteristicsResponse

        protected void processDatacenterCharacteristicsResponse(SimEvent ev)
        Process the response of a request for the characteristics of a Datacenter and then requests the creation of waiting VMs in the received Datacenter. For each Datacenter that a CloudSimTags.DATACENTER_CHARACTERISTICS request was sent, it is expected to receive a response of the same type coming from such Datacenters.
        Parameters:
        ev - a CloudSimEvent object
        Precondition:
        ev != $null
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • processDatacenterCharacteristicsRequest

        protected void processDatacenterCharacteristicsRequest(SimEvent ev)
        Process a request for the characteristics of all Datacenters registered in the Cloud Information Service (CIS) of the simulation.
        Parameters:
        ev - a CloudSimEvent object
        Precondition:
        ev != $null
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • processVmCreateResponseFromDatacenter

        protected boolean processVmCreateResponseFromDatacenter(SimEvent ev)
        Process the ack received from a Datacenter to a broker's request for creation of a Vm in that Datacenter.
        Parameters:
        ev - a CloudSimEvent object
        Returns:
        true if the VM was created successfully, false otherwise
        Precondition:
        ev != null
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • requestCreationOfWaitingVmsToNextDatacenter

        protected void requestCreationOfWaitingVmsToNextDatacenter()
        After the response (ack) of all VM creation request were received but not all VMs could be created (what means some acks informed about Vm creation failures), try to find another Datacenter to request the creation of the VMs in the waiting list.

      • processSuccessVmCreationInDatacenter

        protected boolean processSuccessVmCreationInDatacenter(int vmId,
                                                       int datacenterId)
        Process a response from a Datacenter informing that it was able to create the VM requested by the broker.
        Parameters:
        vmId - id of the Vm that succeeded to be created inside the Datacenter
        datacenterId - id of the Datacenter where the request to create the Vm succeeded
        Returns:
        true if the created VM was found in broker VM list, false otherwise

      • processFailedVmCreationInDatacenter

        protected void processFailedVmCreationInDatacenter(int vmId,
                                                   int datacenterId)
        Process a response from a Datacenter informing that it was NOT able to create the VM requested by the broker.
        Parameters:
        vmId - id of the Vm that failed to be created inside the Datacenter
        datacenterId - id of the Datacenter where the request to create the Vm failed

      • requestDatacentersToCreateWaitingCloudlets

        protected void requestDatacentersToCreateWaitingCloudlets()

        Request Datacenters to create the Cloudlets in the Cloudlets waiting list. If there aren't available VMs to host all cloudlets, the creation of some ones will be postponed.

        This method is called after all submitted VMs are created in some Datacenter.

        See Also:
        submitCloudletList(java.util.List)
        Precondition:
        $none
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • shutdownEntity

        public void shutdownEntity()
        Description copied from interface: SimEntity
        Shuts down the entity. This method is invoked by the CloudSim before the simulation finishes. If you want to save data in log files this is the method in which the corresponding code would be placed.
        Specified by:

      • getVmCreationAcks

        protected int getVmCreationAcks()
        Gets the number of acknowledges (ACKs) received from Datacenters in response to requests to create VMs. The number of acks doesn't mean the number of created VMs, once Datacenters can respond informing that a Vm could not be created.
        Returns:
        the number vm creation acks

      • getDatacenterIdsList

        protected List<Integer> getDatacenterIdsList()

        Returns:

        Returns:
        the VM to Datacenter map
